title: [aerospace] High Employee Turnover Risk in Operations
description: The Operations department has the highest number of employees (14) but lacks a clear distribution of salary grades, with 12 employees at G06 and G07. This could indicate potential dissatisfaction or turnover risk if not addressed.
business_impact: High turnover can lead to operational disruptions and increased hiring costs.

title: [aerospace] Concentration Risk in Baggage Handling
description: All baggage handling records show that 100% of bags are checked and scanned, but with only one origin (ICN) dominating the dataset. This concentration could pose risks if operational issues arise at this airport.
recommendations: Diversify baggage handling operations across multiple airports
Develop contingency plans for disruptions at ICN
business_impact: Operational disruptions at a single location can severely impact overall baggage handling efficiency.

title: [aerospace] High Parts Cost in Aircraft Maintenance
description: The average parts cost for aircraft maintenance is $6,965, with some costs reaching up to $125,000. This indicates a potential inefficiency in maintenance practices or procurement processes.
business_impact: High parts costs can significantly affect overall operational budgets and profitability.
